description: From Latin abscissa, feminine of abscissus, perfect passive participle of abscindō (“cut asunder”).

entries.meaning: Alternative form of abscissa [First attested in the late 17th century.]

verbs.description: absciss (third-person singular simple present abscisses, present participle abscissing, simple past and past participle abscissed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cut off by abscission. [First attested in the mid 19th century.]
(intransitive) To separate (as a leaf from a twig) by abscission. [First attested in the mid 19th century.]
